docs.snippet: Uruguay's incensed President Jose Mujica has lambasted FIFA bosses as "sons of bitches" who meted out "fascist" treatment to striker Luis Suarez for biting an Italian defender at the World Cup....
docs.lead_paragraph: Uruguay's incensed President Jose Mujica has lambasted FIFA bosses as "sons of bitches" who meted out "fascist" treatment to striker Luis Suarez for biting an Italian defender at the World Cup.

headline.main: Uruguay President Insults FIFA Over Suarez

docs.snippet: Javier Aguirre is set to replace Alberto Zaccheroni as Japan coach, with local media reporting on Monday that the former Mexico boss was the only name on the short list....
docs.lead_paragraph: Javier Aguirre is set to replace Alberto Zaccheroni as Japan coach, with local media reporting on Monday that the former Mexico boss was the only name on the short list.

headline.main: Former Mexico Coach Aguirre Lined Up by Japan-Report

docs.snippet: Mexican Javier Aguirre is set to become Japan's new coach following the resignation of Alberto Zaccheroni, local media reported on Monday....

docs.snippet: FIFA has suspended the spokesman of the Brazilian football confederation for one game over a confrontation with Chilean player Mauricio Pinilla on the sidelines during their World Cup match Saturday....
docs.lead_paragraph: FIFA has suspended the spokesman of the Brazilian football confederation for one game over a confrontation with Chilean player Mauricio Pinilla on the sidelines during their World Cup match Saturday.

headline.main: Brazil Spokesman Gets One-Game Ban at World Cup

docs.snippet: Former Penn State assistant football coach Jerry Sandusky has hired a new lawyer to pursue another appeal of his conviction on 45 counts of child sex abuse, the attorney said on Monday....

docs.snippet: After a few days of reflection, Luis Suarez acknowledged what millions saw on TV — he did bite an opponent during a game at the World Cup. In addition, he said he's sorry about it, and promised it will never happen again....
docs.lead_paragraph: After a few days of reflection, Luis Suarez acknowledged what millions saw on TV — he did bite an opponent during a game at the World Cup. In addition, he said he's sorry about it, and promised it will never happen again.

headline.main: Suarez Apologizes for Biting Opponent at World Cup
